newsitem.title: GREECE: NIBID H1 pretax trebles to 5.83 bln drs.
newsitem.headline: NIBID H1 pretax trebles to 5.83 bln drs.

text.p: Greek NIBID Bank, the investment arm of National Bank, said in a statement its half-year pretax profit nearly trebled to 5.83 billion drachmas compared to 1.95 billion a year earlier.
Earnings before provisions, depreciation and tax were up 163.7 percent in the first six months of 1997 to 6.25 billion drachmas from 2.37 billion in the same period in 1996, it said.
As of end-June, NIBID's assets amounted to 212 billion drachmas, up from 101 billion a year earlier.
On the same date, NIBID's own equity reached 30.8 billion drachmas and the bank had taken provisions amounting to 12.8 billion drachmas against bad loans, it said.
